name: undotted
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a letter of the alphabet is undotted, it does not have the dot (= very small round mark) or dots on it that it usually has: Her writing was hard to read, with lower-case I's undotted, G's that looked like Y's, and sentences that ran into margins.
More examplesFewer examplesSince the Turkish letter ö (the double dotted o) sound does not exist in some other languages like Arabic, Greek, etc., it is conveniently represented by the undotted o.You can use the optical character recognition software to distinguish scrawny "L's" from undotted "i's" in reading.For readers unfamiliar with this alphabet, it contains the letters c, s, g, o, u and i (undotted i) both in lower case and upper case.
